originalText.text: I was referred to this doctor by a friend of mine. When I called to schedule my first appontment his secretary said Dr. Berkeley was not taking any new patients that identified as part of the LGBTQ community. Is this even legal in New York? Never felt this discriminated before.

originalText.text: Dr Berkeley is never there.  The nurses are very nice, but they make the decisions on how to proceed. They lie ALOT.  The nurses are not doctors.  I just wish Berkeley paid attention to his patients charts weekly.  Some clients need prior surgeries, and it‚Äôs not good at all if the DOCTOR doesn‚Äôt keep up on her.    unnecessary tests because they ( forgot or aren‚Äôt reading her chart ) or missing pieces in the med package that wasn‚Äôt addressed on their end.

originalText.text: Dr. Berkeley is a super nice and knowledgable doctor. He always listened to my concerns and brought up solutions based on facts. He was easy to reach out with the help of his assistant. But you have to make appointment at least a week before if you want to meet him in person, as he seems very busy. I truly appreciate his help.
